conclusion: To find the time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C on the semicylinder, we can break down the problem into its horizontal and vertical components and use the principles of projectile motion.
Identify the Given Information and Variables: Radius of the semicylinder, R = 0.75 m. Angle between OC and the horizontal direction, θ = 53°. g = 10 m/s². sin(37°) = 0.6 and cos(37°) = 0.8.

Determine the Vertical and Horizontal Components of the Motion: Let the initial velocity of the ball at point B be v₀. The ball moves horizontally from B to C. The time of flight (t) is the same for both horizontal and vertical motions.
The horizontal distance traveled by the ball is R cos(53°).
The vertical distance covered by the ball is the height from point B to point C.

premise: The horizontal distance x is covered in time t.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is approximately 0.346 s.
conclusion: The time taken is approximately 0.346 seconds.
